meanings.definition: Moving powerfully or forcefully forward or upward.
meanings.sent1: The surging waves crashed against the shore.
meanings.sent2: The surging river carried debris downstream.
meanings.sent3: The surging wind nearly blew off my hat!
meanings.sent5: The surging crowd pushed forward eagerly.

meanings.sent1: The music volume kept surging during the concert.
meanings.sent2: The car engine revved up, surging with power.
meanings.sent3: His excitement surged when he won the game.
meanings.sent4: The surging demand for tickets caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The surging applause filled the auditorium with energy.

meanings.sent1: The surging of the ocean waves was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: The surging of the crowd carried them closer to the stage.
meanings.sent3: The surging of the music made everyone dance uncontrollably.
meanings.sent4: The surging of the stock market caused excitement among investors.
meanings.sent5: The surging of emotions in the room was palpable.
